Interface Query<T>

All Superinterfaces:

All Known Subinterfaces:

All Known Implementing Classes:

public interface Query<T>
extends java.lang.Iterable<T>

Method Detail

fetchFirst

T fetchFirst()
Returns:
the first element in the query range, or null if no elements exist.

fetchAll

java.util.Collection<T> fetchAll()
Returns:
a collection of elements in the query range

count

long count()
Return the total number of elements in the query. Even if the query was been paginated, count will allways return the total elements count number.

Returns:
the total number of elements in the query

isEmpty

boolean isEmpty()
Returns:
true if count would return 0, false otherwise.

limit

Query<T> limit(int startAt,
               int maxCount)
Creates a new query base on the same criteria used for this but with limited elements

Parameters:
startAt - ordinal position of the first element in the new query (1 is the first)
maxCount - the maximum quantity of elements to fecth.
Returns:
